The Frog Framework Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
AddressFamilySpecifies addressing schemes that the framework will use
ApplicationExceptionThis is the base class for all exceptions defined by applications
ArgumentNullExceptionThis exception is thrown when a null reference is passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument
ArgumentOutOfBoundsExceptionThis exception is thrown when the value of an argument is outside the allowable range of values defined by the invoked method
ArithmeticExceptionRepresents exceptions caused by arithmetic operations
DivideByZeroExceptionThrown when an attempt to divid a number by zero occurred
EndpointRepresents a network resource or service without protocol attachments
ExceptionThis class and its subclasses indicate conditions that a reasonable application might want to catch
FormatExceptionThis exception is thrown when the format of an argument does not meet the parameter specifications of the invoked method
IllegalArgumentExceptionThis exception is thrown to indicate that an illegal or inappropriate argument was passed to a method
InetAddressThis class represents an Internet Protocol (IP) address
IOExceptionSignals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred
IPEndpointImplements a network endpoint that is an IP socket address (IP address + port)
NetworkInterfaceThis class represents a network interface made up of a name, and a list of IP addresses assigned to this interface
NotImplementedExceptionThis exception is thrown when a requested method or operation is not implemented
NullPointerExceptionThis exception is thrown when an attempt to use a null pointer
ObjectThe class Object is root of the class hierarchy
OverflowExceptionThrown when an arithmetic operation caused a numeric overflow
RuntimeExceptionThis is the superclass of those exceptions that can be thrown during normal framework operation
SingletonA template class for creating single-instance global classes
SystemExceptionThis is the base class for all exceptions defined by the framework
